{{Exclusive|java}}

'''Trim materials''' and '''trim patterns''' define the tooltip and appearance of [[trimming|trimmed]] armor items.

== Definition ==

Trim materials and patterns can be defined in [[data pack]]s, as part of the directory structure below, or inline in the {{cd|[[Data component format#trim|trim]]}} and {{cd|[[Data component format#provides_trim_material|provides_trim_material]]}} data components.

<div class="treeview">
*{{File|archive|''data pack name''.zip}} or {{File|directory|''data pack name''}}
**{{File|file|[[#pack.mcmeta|pack.mcmeta]]}}
**{{File|directory|data}}
***{{File|directory|''namespace''}}
****{{File|directory|'''trim_material'''}}
*****{{File|file|'''{{ph|name}}.json'''}}
****{{File|directory|'''trim_pattern'''}}
*****{{File|file|'''{{ph|name}}.json'''}}
****[[Data pack#Folder_structure|More directories&hellip;]]
</div>

== JSON format ==

=== Trim material ===

Trim materials have the following format:

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}} The root object.
** {{nbt|string|asset_name}}: Suffix to be used in sprite names and [[translation key]]s.
** {{nbt|compound|override_armor_assets}}: Asset name overrides for specific armor materials. Used in vanilla to select darker variants when the trim and armor have the same material.
*** {{nbt|string|{{ph|equipment asset id}}}}: Suffix to be used in sprite names and [[translation key]]s for armor items with the corresponding <code>asset_id</code> specified in the {{cd|[[Data component format#equippable|equippable]]}} data component.
** {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|list}}{{nbt|compound|description}}: Text component to use as the trim material's name. See [[Text component format]].
</div>

=== Trim pattern ===

Trim patterns have the following format:

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}} The root object.
** {{nbt|string|asset_id}}: A [[resource location]] used as a prefix in sprite names and [[translation key]]s.
** {{nbt|boolean|decal}}: False for all vanilla trim patterns.
** {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|list}}{{nbt|compound|description}}: Text component to use as the trim pattern's name. See [[Text component format]].
</div>
